# systemLayoutFittingSizeDidChange(forChildContentContainer:)

**Instance Method**

Notifies the container that a child view controller was resized using Auto Layout.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func systemLayoutFittingSizeDidChange(forChildContentContainer container: any UIContentContainer)
```

## Parameters

- **container**: The child view controller that received the resizing message.

## Discussion

This method is called when a view controller that doesn’t use Auto Layout has a child view controller that uses Auto Layout and the child view controller is resized. When the child view controller responds to the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView/systemLayoutSizeFitting(_:)] method, the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIContentContainer/systemLayoutFittingSizeDidChange(forChildContentContainer:)] method is sent to the parent view controller.

## Responding to changes in child view controllers

- **size(forChildContentContainer:withParentContainerSize:)**: Returns the size of the specified child view controller’s content.
- **preferredContentSizeDidChange(forChildContentContainer:)**: Notifies an interested controller that the preferred content size of one of its children changed.
- **preferredContentSize**: The preferred size for the container’s content.
